urls.title: Paper: Autoimmune Diseases Are Not Associated with Monoclonal Gammopathy of Undetermined Significance: Results of the Prospective Population-Based Istopmm Study
urls.description: Program: Oral and Poster Abstracts Session: 652. Multiple Myeloma and Plasma Cell Dyscrasias: Clinical and Epidemiological: Poster III Hematology Disease Topics & Pathways: adult, Research, epidemiology, Plasma Cell Disorders, Clinical Research, Diseases, Lymphoid Malignancies, Human, Study Population Ingigerdur S Sverrisdottir, MD 1,2 *, Sigrún Thorsteinsdóttir, MD, PhD 2,3, Sæmundur Rögnvaldsson, MD 4 *, Thor Aspelund, PhD 2 *, Brynjar Vidarsson, MD 5, Páll Torfi Önundarson, MD 5 *, Bjarni Agnarsson, MD

tweets.text: Here is my top list of interesting myeloma abstracts, mostly focusing on MGUS and smoldering, for #ASH22. I have included a mixture of things, including treatment trials, mass spectrometry, risk models, genetics, amyloidosis and more. @mtmdphd

The @iStopMM team is very excited to present our findings at #ASH22

Presentations from the study are, like before, primarily performed by medical student, PhD students, and postdocs. I am so proud of the team!

See you in New Orleans! https://t.co/UdAS2UvU8m

This large, prospective screening study negates the previously reported biological correlation between autoimmune disease, MGUS and LC-MGUS and shows that autoimmune diseases are not associated with MGUS.@iStopMM #mmsm #myeloma #ASH22 #MedTwitter #MedEd #USMIRC https://t.co/MFEKbKLcpJ

Six years since the launch of the iStopMM study today!

On 11/15 2016, we invited all Icelanders >40 years to participate in a clinical trial.
To our surprise, >50,000 participants in <30 days!
In 2018 a world record of 80,759 had signed informed consent (54% of the population). https://t.co/Xx9jsDDKGx

Thank you so much for choosing our abstract from the @iStopMM study @ManniMD1 !
@eliaseythorsson has done a fantastic job with our data which I am confident will provide evidence for physicians to omit bone marrow biopsy in individuals with M-proteins. https://t.co/gKQu3Bphcg

5. I may now be able to omit bone marrow biopsies as part of initial diagnostic workup for a larger set of patients with MGUS, compared to what I currently do in practice (I currently omit for low-risk MGUS (IgG,M protein less than 1.5, normal FLC).

https://t.co/HXfMqxsOtL

@sykristinsson @iStopMM Fantastic achievement and well deserved
@sykristinsson @iStopMM Congratulations. Amazing work
@sykristinsson @iStopMM Dear @sykristinsson and team, you really deliver such existing data sets! Congratulations!

@sykristinsson @iStopMM You are ridiculously productive with a ridiculously productive trial. Congrats to you and your team Sigurdur. 
See you at ASH.
Visionary study with of course great results that will lead to changes in everyday clinical management in myeloma, excited to hear these results at #ASH22 https://t.co/S4CgyPYBMF

Stellar abstract by @iStopMM showing 𝐍𝐨 association between MGUS and Autoimmune Disease, when MGUS detected by population-level screening. A high number of MGUS referrals in pts with autoimmune diseases in our clinics likely represent selection bias 2/2 increased testing! https://t.co/aLCbRFm2WQ

4 orals, 6 posters, 1 educational and 2 Abstract achievement awards at #ASH22 from the @iStopMM study (w/9 different presenters)!
We are ridiculously excited to share our results after screening >75,000 Icelanders for MGUS.
And we are just beginning!
#mmsm 🧵Abstracts:

In the start of this month's iStopMM scientific discussions, Sæmundur Rögnvaldsson – MD at the University of Iceland – shares his experiences and responsibilities within the iStopMM project, as well as the key findings so far.

Watch now: https://t.co/5KZTD7ItZQ https://t.co/Hr2C8asA4n

The iStopMM study has been running since 2016 and continues to produce vital data.

Jon Porir Oskarsson - PhD candidate at the University of Iceland highlights the work he is conducting in the study and the data collected so far.

Watch it now: https://t.co/Df4oGbHbel https://t.co/7ymWzcb3LJ

urls.title: iStopMM Scientific Discussion - Jon Porir Oskarsson

tweets.text:
Last week I defended my PhD thesis: 
“Monoclonal gammopathy of what significance?” 

I’m so proud of this work and so grateful to @sykristinsson, the @iStopMM team, and so many more!

Bonus pic of me in 2016 camping while recruiting labs for istop. It’s been a wild ride… https://t.co/wcEESO5TgJ

Great start of the full board morning session by the amazing @sykristinsson on the current results of @iStopMM study for screening  #MGUS & #SMM and how we approach this topic. Eagerly wait for final results. #mmsm #llmcongress2022 https://t.co/iAVbkKhtfm

The iStopMM trial will provide so much information on MGUS, SMM, and MM for years and decades to come. 

Data from the trial has recently defined normal reference range for free light chains in people with renal failure. https://t.co/ncOLj3btOL

Great Keynote lecture on Screening for MGUS by @sykristinsson at the AMN Meeting. Dr. Kristinsson is leading a nationwide randomized trial, iSTOPMM in Iceland. @IMFmyeloma @iStopMM #medtwitter 

People can talk about screening. Takes great vision and leadership to pull off an RCT https://t.co/NAXrKb5iwt

So proud of @SaemundurMD my PhD student who defended his thesis yesterday.  His performance was outstanding! Congratulations!

And thank you @ADispenzieri for being the perfect opponent! https://t.co/JQ4hu334Ix

@sykristinsson @iStopMM @MSK_Neph Congratulations on a very important study, relevant to hematology & nephrology practice!
The strength of the study is: large # of participants w/more preserved GFR 51 ml/min vs the previous study (29 ml/min) from which FLC & ratio in CKD was derived (cont.)

Interesting work from the phenomenal iStopMM group. This issue is that most EMRs (including Epic) don’t support multiple reference intervals for one lab value. There are alternative approaches, one coming soon from our group! https://t.co/kxxmHAUlud
These data needs to be reflected in lab normal ranges. Borderline raised SFLC is one of the commonest referral reasons from #GeneralPractice/#GP to #TeamHaem. https://t.co/n0vl9eoOh6

New reference intervals for serum free light chains in CKD. Excited to discuss this study in an upcoming talk. It impacts LC-MGUS definition which can be a precursor to LC-MM,AL amyloidosis. New vs old ref. range👇🏽
https://t.co/NkC56WqUZp
#OncoNephrology https://t.co/0gvf2YLY2B

urls.title: Defining new reference intervals for serum free light chains in individuals with chronic kidney disease: Results of the iStopMM study - PubMed
urls.description: Serum free light chain (FLC) concentration is greatly affected by kidney function. Using a large prospective population-based cohort, we aimed to establish a reference interval for FLCs in persons with chronic kidney disease (CKD). A total of 75422 participants of the iStopMM study were screened wit …

tweets.text:
This is great for clinical practice so we can use objective cut points rather than guestimate in those with CKD. 

Of Note, for those who don't do MM everyday, NOTE the units are mg/L in the chart and NOT mg/dL which is often used in the US! https://t.co/68aLK7oXzQ
This should be practice-changing indeed. Overinterpreting FLC assays is not innocuous. https://t.co/r1BaaIW4km
@Pathologists https://t.co/GLhDyyCqKK
👏👏👏 https://t.co/kUEBqkLuCA
The joy this brings me makes me really wonder if I need to get out more... https://t.co/kSNwbAbqMf
Definitely practice changing! I've already started to incorporate this in our MGUS/CKD referrals. #mmsm https://t.co/JfuMi7rPUd
#mmsm FLC https://t.co/V8dK4XXFCe

New definition for light chain MGUS! 

Practice changing: New ref values for free light chains (FLC), kappa+ lambda in people with kidney dysfunction (GFR<60) just published: https://t.co/xWzjdbrMYw @thorirlong 

Avoid unnecessary consultations, bone marrows, and⬇️patient anxiety https://t.co/jGL2LO9cuw

The serum free light chain assay is important for diagnosis & response assessment in MGUS, myeloma, AL amyloidosis. But the normal range is affected by renal function. 

@thorirlong @sykristinsson establish reference ranges in renal failure @BloodCancerJnl https://t.co/t7fz8Ggnzb https://t.co/fIx0XdkIw8

@eliaseythorsson @iStopMM iStopMM is a fantastic study. It will yield important data for years to come.

urls.title: Join me for IMS 2022!
urls.description: Join me at the 19th International Myeloma Society Annual Meeting this August in Los Angeles, California!

tweets.text:
"If screening improves OS, we should, if it doesn't, we shouldn't", "please give me 2 more years. I'll give you the answer" @sykristinsson of @iStopMM 
@SagarLonialMD cautioning generalization from predominantly Caucasian pt base to non-Caucasian pts. #mmsm #IMWG2022 #smm https://t.co/4p1SrQaEVG

11) Does everyone have an MGUS phase before getting myeloma? 

Yes. And usually MGUS phase is there for many years. The iSTOPMM randomized trial led by @sykristinsson is testing the role of screening.

Session 4: Plenary lectures Chair: Thierry Facon, France - Advances in WM, Steven Treon, USA -  ⁦@iStopMM⁩ study – the impact of nationwide screening, Sigurdur Kristinsson, Iceland #COMY22 #mmsm ⁦@COMyCongress⁩ #MGUS #MultipleMyeloma https://t.co/lsqDcql5iV

The 8th World Congress on CONTROVERSIES IN MULTIPLE MYELOMA (COMy) starts tomorrow in Paris. 4 days of fantastic speakers, pretty much covering all aspects of MM/MGUS! @Mohty_EBMT 

My talk: "@iStopMM study - the impact of nationwide  screening" on on at 7.05 pm CEST. https://t.co/Tfbg4KJk2j

We wrote a review on risk factors for MGUS: 

"A common limitation to most previous studies on MGUS and its associations with other diseases, is the fact that they are based on clinical cohorts, resulting in selection bias." https://t.co/L7AM7WumZ7
"... screening studies, such as @iStopMM  are pivotal when it comes to evaluation of the true biological- and epidemiological implications of MGUS, before causation is confirmed."

Next generation myeloma researchers! Congrats!

Medical students @uni_iceland: @Annakaren981 (genetics in MM/SMM) and Astrun H Jonsdottir (⬆️Ca++ in MGUS) present their Bachelor of Science projects. Future stars of myeloma research! #mmsm @SaemundurMD @SigrunThorstei1 @iStopMM https://t.co/DKCcjWcnj6

So, in our quest to cure myeloma, will we medicalize large swathes of society, and diagnose them with diseases, that previously did not exist? 

I do not know the answer to that question, but I ponder deeply.

I anxiously await results from @iStopMM to give us a better answer.

We just pub'd this article on the myeloma mystery - and how the study of an abnormal protein anomaly with a weird name, MGUS, could solve it. This story looks at work from: @IreneGhobrial + @iStopMM. Hold onto your hats this is gonna be a long thread

https://t.co/WzeXBon9bx
Prevention would be SO nice!  @sykristinsson You can do this!  Talk about #MYelomaACTION #myeloma @IMFmyeloma https://t.co/ag3shhEcky

I am so proud to be a @ERC_Research CoG grant recipient. We will build on the success of the @iStopMM and study smoldering myeloma in ridiculous detail! 
Epidemiology, progression, QoL, early intervention, role of mass spectrometry, flow cytometry, germline/somatic genetics #mmsm https://t.co/kvsXiqPh6a

Sigurður Yngvi Kristinsson @uni_iceland, was awarded a grant of EUR 2 million, from @ERC_Research to focus on smoldering myeloma in iStopMM – a national initiative to combat multiple myeloma. The study is conducted by an interdisciplinary research team.
👇
https://t.co/EcqQgZRlxP https://t.co/t6682Q1BDu

What were the key findings of the @iStopMM trial presented at #ASH21 this year? 📚 Read this article for a summary  👉 https://t.co/0u7iUP9OgC 👈
#mmsm #myeloma @SigrunThorstei1 @sykristinsson https://t.co/7eMWfqnDcS
Brilliant myeloma talks @HT_Medical post ASH meeting from Reuben Benjamin and @BygraveCeri car-t optimumm Bellini Endurance and @iStopMM and Isa VRD
Prevalence of Smoldering Multiple Myeloma: Results from the iStopMM Study @iStopMM https://t.co/Na899FfnTy https://t.co/8zqhbeqlVP

Defining New Reference Intervals for Serum Free Light Chains in Individuals with Reduced Kidney Function: Results of the Population- Based on iStopMM Study @iStopMM 
https://t.co/A64Bq8gzpD https://t.co/M721PtWnQz

We take the psychological aspects of screening very seriously in the @iStopMM study.

We checked mental health before screening, immediately after screening, and very regularly thereafter.

In fact we evaluate psychological health more frequently  than the M-spike :) https://t.co/fEI9U0UJnG https://t.co/snpuRcIOXs

So if you’ve noticed that the new @iStopMM study from #ASH21 changed the kappa/lambda light chain thresholds for patients with renal insufficiency, here’s the biological reasoning behind “why”!
#mmsm https://t.co/rA3tFKIjNP https://t.co/AekpZoOxnA
https://t.co/LOhwEA61MM https://t.co/QbgeTSn1Ur
Tell everyone https://t.co/835nF6csvJ https://t.co/zyH7KrWThT

Myeloma
1. New Light chain references in patients with renal dysfunction
https://t.co/KpbZFjIySU
Robust, large, population based data; Amazing work by the @iStopMM team

@sykristinsson @iStopMM @andriclausen @SigrunThorstei1 @SaemundurMD @thorirlong @ThorvardurL @asdisrosa78 @jthorir @KjartanGauti Congratulations on your work!! Looking forward to more studies and data that will come from @iStopMM study and will help define #myeloma

What a fantastic #ASH21 we in the @iStopMM team have had! Thank you all for the great feedback on our very first abstracts and all the encouragement!

It felt amazing!

See you in New Orleans 2022! https://t.co/9Z2enUplWq

Very good review by Dr. Wendy Cozen of the data presented at #ASH21 during the “ASH Advanced COVID Research 2021” around outcome of #COVID19 infection in hematology patients. Low/no increased risk in MGUS patients from ⁦@iStopMM⁩ highlighted again. #mmsm https://t.co/tFdjKyLkQS
Great presentation by the iStopMM group! Amazing work! #ASH21 @sykristinsson @iStopMM https://t.co/ZilGlNNvhu

New suggested renal reference intervals for kappa and lambda FLC -> updated prevalence of light chain MGUS in individuals with CKD @thorirlong @iStopMM #mmsm #ASH21 #ASH21_MSKMM https://t.co/5fFqeom9pB
The highlight of ASh in many ways has been this iStopMM study! Congrats @sykristinsson #ASH21 https://t.co/nm2lPOzk1f

@thorirlong explains free light chain (FLC) values in individuals with renal dysfunction. Based on >75000 @iStopMM participants, of which >70000 had s-creatinine values, he is proposing new reference ranges for people with renal failure @TheBindingSite @IMFmyeloma @sykristinsson https://t.co/TH8rJa3302
“I will now tell you what happens when you screen a whole nation for #MGUS” -@sykristinsson @iStopMM #ASH21 #mmsm https://t.co/hRTRrmIjtd

tweets.text:
Key finding from #ASH21: active screening and testing of MGUS increases the diagnosis of malignant gammopathies.

Key finding from #ASH31: does this increase overall survival?

@sykristinsson and the @iStopMM will give us the answer. Huge congratulations!
#mmsm https://t.co/m5xt61q1a1

Finally, in the last @iStopMM presentation today at #ASH21 , in the RCT portion it was shown that active monitoring identified significantly higher portion of individual with smoldering and active disease, laying a path toward early screening #mmsm https://t.co/YlJ4LluhWU https://t.co/G2MdlAeJfL

@FrancescoMaura4 @iStopMM @DrOlaLandgren @DrGarethMorgan1 I belive I said that you detect more cases by screening BUT we advice against systematic MGUS screening until final data from @iStopMM are out :) https://t.co/DnLWrT42wU

My clinically relevant #pcd #ASH2021. #iStopMM #151,156+542; #821-posttx w/ #bispecifics in RRMM; #79 GRIFFIN, #84 BELLINI, #481 MASTER #2724 CAEL #amyloidosis @sykristinsson @End_myeloma @myelomaMD @IMFjimMYELOMA @IMFnurseMyeloma @khouri_jack @JasonValent1 @Amyloid_Planet #mmsm
